name: Computing Runtime & Execution
description: Sector template for computing runtime patents including VMs, scheduling, error detection, and software development.
contextDescription: Computing runtime patents cover the execution layer of computing systems. Key areas include virtualization/VMs (G06F9/45*), process scheduling (G06F9/50*), error detection/correction (G06F11*), program development (G06F8*), and I/O systems (G06F3*). High-value targets include VMware, Microsoft Azure, AWS, Google Cloud, and container platforms like Docker/Kubernetes.
scoringGuidance: VM and container patents are heavily used in cloud infrastructure - very high licensing potential.
Error detection/correction patents are fundamental to all computing systems.
Process scheduling patents read on operating systems and hypervisors.
Look for patents covering multi-tenant isolation, live migration, or resource management.
Hardware-accelerated virtualization (Intel VT-x, AMD-V) creates additional licensing targets.

questions.question: At what execution layer does this patent operate? Score: 1-3 for application-only, 4-6 for OS/kernel, 7-10 for hypervisor/firmware level.
questions.reasoningPrompt: Lower-level patents have broader infringement scope. Identify the execution layer.

questions.question: How relevant is this patent to cloud infrastructure (AWS, Azure, GCP)? Consider VMs, containers, serverless, and orchestration.
questions.reasoningPrompt: Cloud providers are high-value targets. Assess relevance to major cloud platforms.

questions.question: Does this patent address multi-tenant isolation, resource partitioning, or workload separation? Critical for cloud security.
questions.reasoningPrompt: Multi-tenancy is fundamental to cloud computing. Assess isolation mechanisms.

questions.question: Does this patent improve system reliability, fault tolerance, or disaster recovery? Consider error detection, checkpoint/restart, and failover.
questions.reasoningPrompt: Reliability patents are essential for enterprise and cloud systems.
